WorkItem.Description:
In visual studion 2010 and Blend an exception occurs when adding an Accordion control:
 
simple example (xaml):
 
<layoutToolkit:Accordion>
      <layoutToolkit:AccordionItem>test</layoutToolkit:AccordionItem>
</layoutToolkit:Accordion>
 
 
above XAML results in a design time exception:
 
Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at System.Windows.Controls.AccordionItem.<StartAction>b__0() in C:\...Toolkit-release\Layout\Accordion\System\Windows\Controls\AccordionItem.cs:line 714
   at System.Windows.Controls.AccordionItem.StartAction() in C:\...Toolkit-release\Layout\Accordion\System\Windows\Controls\AccordionItem.cs:line 763
   at System.Windows.Controls.AccordionItem.Schedule(AccordionAction action) in C:\...Toolkit-release\Layout\Accordion\System\Windows\Controls\AccordionItem.cs:line 676
   at System.Windows.Controls.AccordionItem.OnApplyTemplate() in C:\...Toolkit-release\Layout\Accordion\System\Windows\Controls\AccordionItem.cs:line 892
   at System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate()
   at Microsoft.Expression.Platform.WPF.WpfViewNodeManager.EnsureElementInDictionary(Object root, ViewNode knownAncestor)
WorkItem.Summary: Accordion control: design time exception in AccordionItem

Comments.Message: What is interesting, you can hide this exception by changing this AccordionItem e.g. by adding space and Visual Studio will recalculate xaml structure. Added space could be removed and still no exception will be thrown as long as the project won't be built or design view won't be closed and reopened. But then add and remove space to hide exception again...
No work around for this yet? I can run my app but I can't interact with the designer. Good thing I can do things with XAML though.
